title: Covid-19 Cases Rise in U.K. Schoolchildren, Whom the Nation Hesitated to Vaccinate
sub_head: The U.K. began inoculating teenagers later than the U.S. and Europe; more than a third of recent infections in England were among those 10 to 19
body:
LONDONâ€”Coronavirus infections among schoolchildren in the U.K. have pushed daily caseloads to stubbornly high levels, a setback that underscores how Britain now trails many of its European neighbors on vaccination after staking out an early lead.
The U.K. began vaccinating teenagers in August, far later than in the U.S. and Europe, and decided to drop almost all public-health restrictions during the summer, amid optimism that vaccines had checked the fast-spreading Delta variant.
